articleContentTranslated: Adolf Peichl died after a long illness in his house in Friesach. He was born in Vienna, worked at the Stadttheater Baden and the Stadttheater Klagenfurt.

As an actor he worked at the KomÃ¶dienspiele Porcia, the Theater bei Auersperg, the Sommerspiele Laxenburg, the cabaret â€œGiftzwergeâ€, the Sommerspiele RÃ¶ttingen, the Graz Opera House, the Volksoper Vienna and many others.
He became known throughout Austria as the Yugoslavian house servant Malec.

He directs, among other things, the Stadttheater Klagenfurt, the Bad Ischl Operetta Festival, the South Carinthian Summer Games, the Friesacher Burghofspiele, the WeiÃŸenstein Summer Games, â€œJedermannâ€ on Domplatz Klagenfurt or the Karl May Festival in Weitensfeld.

Adi Peichl died today at the age of 75 after a long illness ğŸ˜¢As an actor he was among other things as a house servant ... Posted by Velden Tourismus on Friday, December 11, 2020 Numerous honors Peichl was the holder of the Golden Decoration of Honor of the Republic of Austria, the Georg Bucher Prize of Carinthia, he was awarded the Great Golden Decoration of Honor of the State of Carinthia and was a holder of the Ring of honor of the municipality of Friesach, the municipality of WeiÃŸenstein and the Friesacher Burghofspiele.
He would have been 75 on December 27th.
